thread.title: TV best bets: Sun., Oct. 18 - TV
thread.title_full: TV best bets: Sun., Oct. 18 - TV - NorthJersey.com

author: The Record
title: TV best bets: Sun., Oct. 18 - TV
text:
8 p.m., BRAVO: The Real Housewives of New Jersey — In a new episode called "Mr. Mom for Shore," the Giudice family makes a trip to the Jersey Shore for an annual summer ritual, visiting their beloved vacation house for what may be the last time before it goes on the auction block. Even as he tries to enjoy an Independence Day celebration, Joe takes time out to dine with an ex-convict to hear all about prison life and begins to prepare the girls for his departure. 
8 p.m., TCM: The Grim Game — Only recently rediscovered and restored, this 1919 silent thriller stars Harry Houdini as Harvey Hanford, an unjustly accused killer who uses his skills as an escape artist and magician to flee police custody and search for the men who framed him. Long believed to be lost, this film was found in 2014 among the effects of a recently deceased former juggler, who bought the only known copy from the Houdini estate in 1947. Before tonight's premiere, this restoration was screened last March in Los Angeles at a TCM festival. 
9 p.m., HALLMARK CHANNEL: Jesse Stone: Lost in Paradise — Tom Selleck marks his 10th anniversary of playing mystery novelist Robert B. Parker's small-town police chief in this new TV movie, which finds Stone serving as a consultant on an unsolved murder case in Boston. The Beantown police suspect the homicide was the work of "The Boston Ripper," a serial killer who is now behind bars, but Stone thinks the guilty party is someone closer to home. 
10 p.m., HBO: Project Greenlight — In a new episode called "Hot Ghetto Mess," tension levels rise as Jason and the crew prepare for the film's most expensive scenes yet — a wedding rehearsal dinner that must be filmed during a few brief hours around dusk. Also making some people nervous — the film's final shoot, a complicated and potentially dangerous car-crash scene. 
10 p.m., WNET/CHANNEL 13: The Widower — In the conclusion of the new drama, Simone (Archie Panjabi) maintains thoughts of having a child and takes steps to that end, not realizing what Malcolm Webster (Reece Shearsmith) has in store for her. Suspicious investigator Charlie Henry (John Hannah) finds the means to step in when an embezzling allegation prompts a search of Webster's house — plus a warning to Simone, who then becomes aware of Webster's status with Felicity (Kate Fleetwood).
